Cops clash with mini-bus driver in north.description: NEW DELHI: There was high drama in north Delhi's Mukherjee Nagar on Sunday evening when a group of policemen clashed with a Gramin Sewa driver and his son, a minor. The incident was captured by passersby on mobile phone and the footage went viral. In the video, a few policemen were seen hitting the driver with sticks and then kicking him. The man was later detained. However, Delhi Police, in a statement, claimed that the incident took place after the driver hit a police van and started arguing with cops. Things took a turn for the worse as the driver then allegedly pulled out a sword and assaulted an on-duty officer. While trying to escape from the spot, the accused hit another cop with his vehicle, police said. Later, the policemen chased the vehicle and forced the driver to stop. The juvenile son of the driver also joined the argument, they said. In another video of the incident, the driver was seen arguing with a cop while holding a sword. An inquiry has been initiated into the incident. Meanwhile, five people, including two women, were arrested for assaulting cops who tried to intervene in a fight near Tibia college in central Delhi. The incident happened on Friday evening. CCTV footage was being checked to ascertain the exact sequence of events, police said. AAP holds meets to iron out wrinkles.description: NEW DELHI: Post the Lok Sabha poll debacle, Aam Aadmi Party has started a series of interactions with party workers across all 70 assembly constituencies to find out the weaknesses of the party before the capital plunges into assembly elections in February 2020. AAP could not win any of the seven parliamentary constituencies. It remained far behind Congress, while BJP won all seven seats by amassing a massive 56.5% vote share. Congress got 22.5% votes, while AAP managed to get only 18.1%. So far, 50 such meetings have taken place. A few of them have been chaired by Delhi convener Gopal Rai, MP Sanjay Singh, senior leaders Atishi Marlena, Raghav Chadha and Dilip Pandey. The focus is on figuring out the critical areas where the party needs to focus on to turn around the situation. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has asked party functionaries to work hard for the upcoming polls. A party functionary said senior leaders have been asked to address volunteer meetings in all assembly constituencies to strengthen the party’s position. Atishi, who has addressed meetings in Kondli, Vishwas Nagar and other assembly segments in east Delhi, said: “We are a volunteer-driven party and after every election we sit with our volunteers to understand the results. We have tried to identify our weaknesses and discussed how our performance can be improved in the assembly polls.” The party’s performance in the Lok Sabha polls was far below expectations. AAP was at third position in 48 of the 70 assembly constituencies. In a bid to assuage the concerns of party workers, AAP leaders emphasised that the party didn’t get much votes because it was a “big election” between Narendra Modi and Rahul Gandhi prompting people to vote accordingly. People will vote for AAP in the “small election” (assembly polls), they claimed. An AAP leader privy to the findings of the meetings claimed that the bad results in the parliamentary election have not taken a heavy toll on the enthusiasm of party workers. “The workers are not surprised by the outcome of Lok Sabha election. Functionaries at the assembly level shared that voters confided in them that they didn’t vote for AAP in LS polls because it was a different election,” the party leader added. He further claimed, quoting party functionaries, that during campaigning on the ground people told them, “Iss election mein maaf kar do, Dilli mein Kejriwal ko hi denge (Leave us during this election. For Delhi, we will vote for Kejriwal).” The meetings are also being used as platforms to know public grievances so that the party can focus on critical issues. The outcome of the meetings has been kept confidential. The senior leaders will put up the conclusions drawn from these meetings before CM Kejriwal. The findings will shape the course of AAP’s assembly election strategy. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. CM Arvind Kejriwal raises statehood dema.description: NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal raised the pitch for full statehood for Delhi and an increase in the share of central taxes at the fifth governing council meeting of Niti Aayog at Rashtrapati Bhawan on Saturday. This was the first meeting of the planning body after the formation of a new government at the Centre. It was attended by chief ministers, lieutenant governors of Union territories, central ministers and senior government officials. Addressing the gathering, Kejriwal reiterated that Delhi should be given the status of a full-fledged state, which had been promised for several years but denied by successive central governments. This demand was one of the key planks of the Aam Aadmi Party in the Lok Sabha elections. During campaigns Kejriwal, his ministers and candidates consistently argued that Delhi’s holistic development wasn’t possible unless it became a full state. Not being a full state has led to wrangling over jurisdiction between the AAP government and the lieutenant governor. While AAP blamed the LG for delaying or scuppering many projects, the LG’s office demanded procedural propriety. Under the current system, the elected government has jurisdiction over all subjects except the police, law and order and land, but the Supreme Court has ruled that control of the services department is in the hands of the LG, who is an appointee of the Union government. AAP reasons that as a full state it will have control over Delhi’s land, enabling it to make several welfare decisions, from allotting land for schools and clinics to providing housing for the city’s residents. It will also get control of the law enforcement agencies and will be able to establish an anti-corruption bureau introduce reforms in Delhi police. The state government can also fill departmental vacancies under the powers given to a full-fledged state, the party argued. Kejriwal also took up the issue of Delhi’s share in central taxes, which has been static at Rs 325 crore for several years. “According to the 14th Finance Commission, states get 42% share in central taxes, but Delhi gets a paltry Rs 325 crore,” the CM said. The AAP government claims that Delhi’s contribution to the Union government’s tax pool has almost doubled from Rs 54,705 crore in 2008-09 to Rs 1,08,882 in 2016-17, but the grants it receives in lieu have remained stuck at Rs 325 crore. Water was another issue that Kejriwal focused on at the Niti Aayog meeting. He sought the Centre’s cooperation in his government’s mega project for the natural storage of water in the Yamuna floodplain. “Important studies, including by IIT Delhi, show that in case this is done, water storage during a single monsoon will be sufficient to end the water shortage in Delhi for two years,” a statement quoted the CM as saying. Soon, Delhi metro cards to have auto top.description: NEW DELHI: Recharging your Delhi Metro smart cards is set to get easier. Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has signed an agreement with a private technology company, Anduril Technologies private Ltd, to provide the new smart cards, which would automatically get recharged. The new electronically-rechargeable cards get automatically updated when the commuter taps it at the entry gate. The facility will initially be available on the new set of cards, but will subsequently be added to the existing ones too. According to estimates, about 16-17 lakh daily commuters use the cards. Since its launch in 2002, Delhi Metro has sold over 1.5 crore cards till now. The new cards, ‘Autope’, are likely to be rolled out next month. The customers will first have to register themselves on its app or website, and the cards will then be home-delivered. Once the system stabilises, the facility will be extended to the existing card holders as well. “Waiting in a long queue is the biggest challenge a commuter faces at the stations. Although online recharges are prevalent, the card has to be presented to the add value machine (AVM) for top-ups. The new technology will allow auto recharge of smart card as and when the value falls below a threshold,” said Anurag Bajpai, founder, Anduril Technologies private Ltd. Though some banks issue cards that get automatically recharged, the new ones can be linked to any bank account. The company has already launched the new set for a closed user group. “The launch is scheduled in mid-July,” Bajpai said. Other than Delhi Metro, the feature will soon be rolled out in Mumbai and other metro networks. “The idea is to enable a seamless and hassle-free payment for recurring transactions,” Bajpai said. \u2018Land issues hold up piped water to.description: NEW DELHI: Around 130 unauthorised colonies in the capital are not likely to get piped water supply anytime soon as work is stuck due to non-availability of no-objection certificates (NOCs) from landowning agencies, according to the Delhi Jal Board. DJB vice-chairman Dinesh Mohaniya said NOCs are not available for laying water pipelines in some unauthorised colonies, while it’s not feasible to undertake work in the rest. “Land-owning agencies give NOCs for laying water pipelines in any area. In these cases, they haven’t. For example, Archeological Survey of India may not give NOC for laying pipelines if an authorised colony comes up on its land,” he said. “Some unauthorised colonies have come up in such a haphazard manner that the first house is 10 feet away from the second and the second is 20 feet away from the third. Because of this, it’s not possible to lay water pipelines in such areas,” Mohaniya added. In the absence of piped water supply, residents of unauthorised colonies rely on DJB and private tankers, and illegal borewells. Officials said NOCs for most of the colonies are awaited from the forest department. According to an audit report of AAP government’s work done in 2018-19, NOCs are not available for 95 unauthorised colonies and work is not feasible in 36 others. There are a total of 1,725 unauthorised colonies in Delhi. People living there are believed to be the core vote bank of the AAP. As many as 1,230 unauthorised colonies got water pipelines by the end of 2017-18. DJB had set a target of laying water pipelines in another 291 unauthorised colonies in 2018-19. It, however, could complete work in only 144 such localities. Ahead of the Delhi assembly elections early next year, AAP dispensation has set a target of laying water pipelines in 151 unauthorised colonies. The Arvind Kejriwalled AAP government claims it gave piped water to 372 unauthorised colonies in last four years. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now buses for Haridwar from Gr Noida twi.description: GREATER NOIDA: Given the ensuing 'Char Dham Yatra' of religious pilgramges to holy shrines, part of which - Kedarnath, Badrinath - fall in Uttarakhand region and increased demands from residents in Greater Noida, Muzaffarnagar, Meerut and Roorkee, the UP State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) has started daily bus service from Greater Noida depot to Haridwar on Friday. The buses will ply twice a day - 5:30am (with actual departure time at 6am) from Greater Noida depot via Alpha commercial metro station in Greater Noida and again at 7pm. The fare from Greater Noida depot is Rs 279 and from Alpha commercial metro station is Rs 275. "There was increasing demand for the bus service to Haridwar from residents of Greater Noida especially those belonging to Uttarakhand. So we have provided this facility which will benefit residents of not only Noida and Greater Noida, but also Ghaziabad, Meerut, Roorkie etc," Luv Kumar assistant regional manager (ARM) Greater Noida depot, Gautam Budh Nagar UPSRTC told TOI. According to Kumar, the route of the bus with capacity of 52 passengers per trip will include Noida via Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Modinagar, Meerut, Muradnagar, Khatauli, Muzaffarnagar, UP border, Roorkee, Jwalapur to Haridwar. Kumar further maintained that the number of buses might be increased depending on the demand. "We have started with services twice a day - morning and evening. But these can be increased if there is demand for the same," said Kumar. JPS Rawat, president Uttarakhand cultural committee, maintained that there are many residents from Uttarakhand residing in Greater Noida. "Besides it is a requirement for all residents and will benefit the district in the long run," said Rawat. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Light rain in Delhi-NCR brings relief fr.description: NEW DELHI: The national capital and its surrounding regions on Sunday received light rains bringing much-needed respite from the scorching heat. At present, the maximum and minimum temperatures in Delhi are hovering at 40 degree Celsius and 28 degree Celsius, respectively. The India Meteorological Department has predicted rains and thunderstorms in the region for tomorrow also. As per Skymet, a private weather forecasting agency, Delhi witnessed the longest period of heat wave in the Monsoon season due to the prolonged dry period from June 1-13. This has made the region the driest of the country with its cumulative rainfall deficiency mounting to 100 per cent. At present, the air quality in Delhi is in moderate category with an index value of 192, according to SAFAR (System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting). The organisation has adviced people who are "usually sensitive" to consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion and take it easy if symptoms such as coughing or shortness of breath occurs. 200 Delhi government schools to get CCTV.description: NEW DELHI: When the students of about 200 Delhi government schools return after the summer vacation, they will find two CCTV cameras in each classroom. This will also allow parents to see what their children are doing inside the class. The first phase of the government’s ambitious project to install CCTV cameras in all classrooms of its 1,100 schools will be completed by July. Delhi government had announced the project in the 2017-18 budget, but a delay in the tendering process resulted in its reintroduction in the 2018-19 budget. After a successful pilot run in one school, the project is now being implemented in a phased manner. The installation has been challenged in the Supreme Court on the ground that the move will put psychological pressure on the children. But “there was no stay on the project so we are moving forward with it”, Binay Bhushan, director of the directorate of education, told TOI. In May, the court just sought a reply from the government. This scheme has often been opposed by teachers and educationists on the ground that it’s a form of surveillance and won’t help either the teachers or the students. According to Delhi government, the project will ensure safety and security in schools. The government has allocated Rs 600 crore (approx) for the installation and maintenance of the 1.2 lakh cameras. The access and control of the cameras in all classrooms, corridors and the rest of the school premises will be with the principal of each school. Each school will now get 150-200 cameras instead of the usual one-two at the main gate. The smartphone interface for the parents is still being developed. “The parents will be given access only to the classroom of their child through a password-protected system,” said Bhushan. However, teachers alleged that the move would affect the natural process of teaching and learning. Sant Ram, a teacher at Sarvodaya Bal Vidyalaya, Subhash Nagar, said, “A classroom is a free space for students and teachers. Now if someone is constantly watching, the behaviour of the children and the teacher will not remain natural. It is a useless exercise.” For safety, the cameras should be installed only at the entry-exit gates and the government should utilise the money to install CCTVs in dark spots around the city, he claimed. “Does the government even know that most of these parents use basic phones?” Government School Teachers’ Association (GSTA) is also opposed to the move. “Once the classes start, we will see how the cameras are intruding into our and students’ privacy, then we will react,” said Ajay Veer Yadav, general secretary, GSTA. “Just like chief minister Arvind Kejriwal had cut the electric cables, we will do the same to the CCTVs if it intervenes with the teaching-learning process.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nWhen 'geniuses' Nawazuddin Siddiqui, U.description: Nawazuddin Siddiqui and director Anil Sharma along with debutants Utkarsh Sharma and Ishita Chauhan visited Delhi for a promotional event for their upcoming film 'Genius'. The film, which is releasing on August 24, also stars Mithun Charkraborty and Ayesha Jhulka.  Actors Utkarsh Sharma and Ishita Chauhan shake a leg in Delhi Director Anil Sharma said, "It's a story about the confrontation between two geniuses, and even though both of them are right in their own way, but their point of views are very different. The best part about the film is the freshness of the young pair and the confrontation scenes between Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Utkarsh Sharma according to me."  Nawazuddin Siddiqui and director Anil Sharma during the movie promotion in Delhi Working with Nawazuddin Siddiqui was like a dream come true, said Utkarsh Sharma. Talking about his experience of working with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Utkarsh said, "I have followed his work from the time when he did the role of a supporting character in a film called New York. He's a natural actor who makes you forget that you’re watching him in a film, it feels like you're watching him in real life. While working with him in Genius, I had doubts about myself as I had to act in front of him, but you know, when he enters the set, he comes as a character not as the legend or the enigma he is. So, in a way he makes your work easy because it's the character you're speaking to. When you improvise your dialogues with an actor like Nawazuddin Siddiqui, it feels like you have earned a degree." - Shrishti.Bhatia@timesgroup.comIn Video:Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Utkarsh Sharma and Ishita Chauhan visit Delhi to promote 'Genius'Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

DU may scrap additional riders for all c.description: NEW DELHI: With Delhi University set to release an updated bulletin of information on undergraduate admissions on Monday, sources said it was likely that the additional eligibility criteria introduced for all subjects might be done away with. The university is amending the criteria following orders from Delhi high court. A student had moved court over the additional eligibility criteria introduced for BA (Hons) Economics and BCom (Hons). On Friday, HC asked the university to return to the old eligibility criteria in these two courses and extend the registration process till June 22. Earlier, the last day for registration was June 14. Under the new criteria, the university had made inclusion of mathematics compulsory in the calculation of the best-of-four for BCom (Hons). Also, an applicant was required to have scored 50% or more in mathematics to be eligible. Till last year, even pass marks in the subject would have sufficed. The additional eligibility criteria was introduced for a host of other subjects. The new requirements included a minimum of 55% in English and Hindi for English (Hons) and Hindi (Hons), respectively. Till last year, there was no such requirement. Even for language courses, such as Persian, Urdu, Arabic (Hons) and BA programme, DU had introduced a rider of 40% in either Class X or XII in these subjects. “The admission committee has been told to look into all criteria that are going to disadvantage students. It’s likely that the additional eligibility requirements may be done away in all cases,” a senior university official, on condition of anonymity, said. Quashing the amendment, a bench of Justices Anu Malhotra and Talwant Singh had said, “There is no dispute that you (DU) have to be in tune with the times. Nothing prevents you from improving the education standards. No one is saying that your decision is not right, but your timing may not be right.” DU can carry out any amendment in the eligibility criteria by giving a six-month notice before the admissions, it added. However, the changes relating to lowering of percentage deduction for change in streams from 2.5% to 1% will stay. The HC ruling has come as a shot in the arm for several students. Varun Jatav, who wanted to pursue Hindi (Hons), said: “I had 54% marks in Hindi in my Class XII boards. Due to the new rules that were introduced, I was not able to fill up the form.” Jatav, who hails from Haryana, said his best-of-four came to 85%. The changes effected by DU had come on the recommendation of committees in the respective departments. According to the rules, these suggestions have to be ratified by the standing committee and the academic as well as executive councils after which they are notified. But, generally, once the standing committee approves the changes, these are approved by the vice-chancellor. At the statutory body meetings, these changes are listed as reporting items. Hence, this year, even before the matter reached the court, the EC members had written to VC, asking him to withdraw these criteria, as they did not have appropriate approvals. Now, as the university is taking a relook at these changes, the admission schedule has gone haywire — right from releasing cutoffs to the trial schedule for sports and extra-curricular activities. St Stephen’s College has also extended its dates and the cut-off for interviews will now be released on June 24. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A vehicle-free Sadar Bazar: Idea whose t.description: NEW DELHI: The massively congested Sadar Bazar market, which sees nearly a lakh visitors daily, may be pedestrianised before August 15. A senior north corporation official said a sensitisation meeting with local traders was held on Friday with the focus on identifying locations where the additional vehicle parking load could be shifted. The corporation plans to conduct a detailed survey of the area before implementing the project. The survey is aimed at understanding the ground situation, such as the available parking space, tentative number of vehicles parked on the roads, street parking available, the kind and amount of encroachments, the number of roads to be pedestrianised and arrangements that could be made for animal-powered vehicles, the official said. The move comes after the corporation successfully pedestrianised Ajmal Khan Road in Karol Bagh and regularised parking and traffic movement there. It also hiked on-street parking rates to discourage private cars and is currently carrying out work for improving the parking condition on connecting roads. “Since the nature of Sadar Bazar market is different from Karol Bagh, we need to understand the ground situation before preparing any plan. We may need to shift unauthorised vending from the area, but everything will be done after a consensus with the market associations and shopkeepers,” the official said. But the marking and lane division on the 600m stretch — from Sadar Thana to Bara Tooti Chowk — will be carried out on similar lines and traffic restrictions are expected to be in place for a month and a half. So far, the civic body has identified two locations as alternative parking space. “We can use the nearby Idgah area that used to house the slaughterhouse earlier. It can cater to around 700 vehicles. We also have the option of using a plot of the old zonal municipal corporation office, which can accommodate another 80 vehicles,” he said. At its house meeting last month, the civic agency had approved a “management plan” for busy markets, such as Sadar Bazar and Kamla Nagar, which entailed decongesting these shopping hubs and increasing on-street parking charges. The project for decongestion and pedestrainising Sadar Bazar was taken up on the request of the market association there. Devraj Baweja, general secretary of Confederation of Sadar Bazar Traders Association, said haphazard parking and traffic jams were major problems. “A decongestion plan on the lines of Karol Bagh is required in the area. The civic body should provide ample off-street parking before restricting roadside parking,” he said. The market remains one of the most congested in the city. The corporation official said: “We have observed that pedestrianisation of Ajmal Khan Road has had a positive impact on traffic circulation as well the air quality. We have got positive response from the market association here.” As a part of the project, the street will be marked with yellow and white stripes, demarcating space for hawkers and non-mortised vehicles. There will also be a provision for street furniture like benches and greenery. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

DU colleges will verify papers after int.description: NEW DELHI: The DU colleges can’t keep the original documents of the candidates during the undergraduate admissions this year, but that doesn’t mean that there won’t be any check. Once the admission process is over, the colleges will collect the documents and get them verified. As per a Delhi high court order, the colleges will have to return the original documents immediately after the admission this year so that students can easily withdraw and shift to another college if necessary. But “depending on their schedule, the colleges will ask for the documents after the admission. Then these will be verified”, said an official of the admission committee at DU. The verification will either be forensic or with the respective boards. “During the verification, if any college finds any certificate to be fake, the admission will be cancelled immediately. It is a criminal offence to submit fake documents,” said the official. Some colleges like Ramjas and Sri Guru Tegh Bahadur Khalsa had previously conducted forensic tests of all documents during the admission period. For the CBSE students, the marks details are uploaded during the registration process itself from this year. In the past, there had been instances of candidates submitting marksheets from fake boards. This year, the university will also carry out forensic tests for the postgraduate courses. The decision follows the controversy over the fake marksheet of Delhi University Student Union president Ankiv Basoya last year. Docs' stir hits OPD services in Delhi ho.description: NEW DELHI: OPD services are likely to be affected on Monday at Safdarjung, Ram Manohar Lohia and several other public hospitals in Delhi on account of the protest call given by the Indian Medical Association (IMA). The resident doctors of these hospitals have decided to join the protest to express solidarity with their counterparts in West Bengal. The resident doctors of AIIMS, at the forefront of the protests in Delhi, have decided not to take part in the protest call by the IMA. Routine services are likely to be affected at private hospitals and nursing homes as well, with the Delhi Medical Association (DMA) endorsing IMA’s call for protest and issuing an appeal to its 18,000 member doctors to withdraw non-essential services in view of the stalemate in West Bengal. “All clinics, nursing homes, diagnostic centres and hospitals are requested to shut down routine services,” the appeal from DMA, which was issued on Sunday evening, stated. At Safdarjung hospital, doctors said emergency services including casualty, ICU and labour room shall not be affected by the strike. “Strike shall include OPD, elective OT and ward services,” said Dr Prakash Thakur, president of the Resident Doctors’ Association of Safdarjung Hospital, which gets close to 8,000 patients daily. Meanwhile, most of the residents continued to wear bandages to mark their protest and express solidarity with the doctors in Kolkata. The doctors are demanding a central law to deal with violence against medical professionals. Hospitals should be declared as safe zones and provision of appropriate security should be the responsibility of the state, doctors said. Resident doctors have been agitating since Tuesday in Kolkata demanding security for themselves in government hospitals, after two of their colleagues were attacked and seriously injured allegedly by relatives of a patient who died at the NRS Medical College and Hospital. “All the doctors will assemble at the IMA headquarters on Monday for a peaceful protest,” said an IMA official. In Video:OPD services might be affected by doctors’ strike in DelhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

\nSara Ali Khan promotes Kedarnath in No.description: A day before the release of Kedarnath - her debut film - actor Sara Ali Khan visited DLF Mall of India to promote the film. With fans cheering her name and congratulating the actor for her first movie, it was an overwhelming feeling for the actor to witness this response right before the release of her debut movie. "I am so excited. I actually thought that there will only be 10-20 people here, do-teen photos khichayenge. lekin ye kya hai? I am speechless. I don't stammer usually but I don't have any words now. Thank you so much, thank you for being here, thank you for making me feel so special," she said. As Sara clicked selfies with her fans, a guy also dedicated a song to the actor on stage. It wasn't just guys who made special efforts to impress the actor but the girls also came prepared to make the event memorable for her. A girl from the crowd proposed to the actor using a Shah Rukh Khan's dialogue and Sara. "I can't believe this. I just want to say that my first picture has not released yet, maine abhi tak kuch kiya nahi hai, par aap logon ne itna pyar diya hai already, thank you so much. Main ek saal pehle aake issi mall mein shopping karti hoon and aaj yahan itna pyaar dekhke main bol nahi sakti ki kaisa feel ho raha hai," she signed off before shaking a leg with her fans on a song from her movie.  The crowd cheering for Sara at the mall In Video:Sara Ali Khan visits Noida to promote KedarnathDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SDMC plans next Nandan Van in Dwarka.description: NEW DELHI: As the meticulously-designed Nandan Van in Greater Kailash-1 is receiving huge footfall, South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) is developing another park for children to be ready by August-end, this time in Dwarka. The park will be equipped with multi-play equipment, a gazebo, swings and slides. The work is already in progress and the corporation is installing innovative closures and rope bridges between trees at the site. “The park has been recently transferred from the Delhi Development Authority (DDA) and we are using one acre of area for the park. The area has a lot of trees, which is why we are erecting rope bridges,” said a senior SDMC official. “The park is very shady so people can spend time here even during afternoons. With tree decks and colourful cartoon characters all over the park, children will surely have a fun time.” In 2015, Delhi high court had issued directions to the civic bodies to create spaces where children could play safely. In a 2016 study, Delhi Commission for Protection of Child Rights also expressed the same view. After that SDMC developed Nandan Van in B block of Greater Kailash-1 in 2018 — a children’s park with many recreational activities for children up to 12 years of age. As the footfall is huge, the park has a nominal entry fee of Rs 20 to keep away loiterers. Only children and an accompanying guardian will be allowed in. “We aim to maintain same conditions at the Dwarka park as well,” the official said. “The space will be dotted with interactive spaces to engage children both physically and mentally.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Man beaten to death in Delhi's Prem Naga.description: NEW DELHI: A 23-year-old man was beaten to death in Rohini's Prem Nagar area, police said Sunday. Police around 7 pm on Saturday received information that a thief has been caught at the Main Mubarak Pur Road in Prem Nagar and a team was sent to the spot, a senior police officer said. It was found that a man was lying unconscious on the ground and there were injury marks on his body, police said, adding that he was taken to the Sanjay Gandhi Hospital where he was declared brought dead. The person, Amit, who had made the call to inform the police, alleged that last month, a mobile and a DVR of a CCTV camera were stolen from his shop, they said. He said he had the CCTV footage on his mobile phone and the thief can be seen in it, police said, adding that Amit was also taken to the hospital. On Saturday, the suspected thief along with one more person had come again to the shop and were peeping into it, they said. Amit recognised him and he, along with his neighbours, caught both of them and beat them up, police said, adding that there were some more people who thrashed them. The two persons were brought to the shop, but one of them managed to escape, they said. When the person started feeling uneasiness, Amit called the police.He had detained the person hoping that someone from his family would come and he would get some money for the stolen articles. A case under the relevant sections of the IPC has been registered, they added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi government notice to nursing homes.description: NEW DELHI: Delhi government’s health department has issued a show-cause notice to several registered nursing homes and medicare facilities in the city for not submitting fire safety certificates. In the notice, the Directorate General of Health Services (DGHS) has asked why an order of cancellation of registration should not be issued. In it notice, DGHS had mentioned the sequence of letters issued by it to the medicare facilities in the capital, asking them to submit a valid copy of a fire safety clearance certificate, and also mentioned the one received by the directorate from the Delhi Fire Services. “Whereas, a letter... dated 2.8.2018 was issued by this Directorate (DGHS) directing therein to submit a copy of valid fire safety clearance certificate from Delhi Fire Service within one month of receipt of this letter,” the health department’s notice read. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors strike.description: Healthcare in hospitals across the country is set for a major disruption on Monday with   Indian Medical Association   deciding to withdraw non-essential services for a day to express solidarity with their striking colleagues in Bengal. However, in a move that may bring some relief to patients in New Delhi, AIIMS resident doctors have decided not to join the strike. But those in Safdarjung Hospital, Lady Hardinge Medical College, RML Hospital and others will skip work. In Kolkata on Sunday, the agitating doctors said they were ready to meet Mamata Banerjee "anytime and anywhere". The government proposed a 3pm meeting at the state secretariat on Monday. The doctors were reportedly ready to accept the proposal. IMA strike to cripple OPDs todayEarlier, the junior doctors had insisted that the meeting cannot be held behind closed doors and the media should be allowed to telecast it live. The state government, however, cited legalities and constitutional propriety, which prevent such meetings from being held under public glare. The doctors were ready to accept the government's request, sources indicated late Sunday, which would pave the way for "across-the-table" discussions between the protesters and the chief minister. "We are very hopeful for the meeting in Nabanna (state secretariat) on Monday," a senior official, mediating for the state, said. "We have explained to them that given the issues involved, mainly legal, administrative and security-related, it is impossible for the state government to agree to their demand for an open-door meeting in presence of the media. The CM is also sworn to an oath of secrecy in some such matters. We have explained they have every right to speak to media afterwards, much like the norm in all such cases. They have agreed to it," he said. Under pressure from several quarters, including the seniors in the medical fraternity, the junior doctors in Kolkata held a four-hour general body meeting at NRS Hospital. The meeting appeared to split three ways. While a section of doctors agreed to have the meeting at Nabanna, another section stressed on Raj Bhavan as the venue, while the remaining stuck to their demand for NRS Hospital. Pressure further mounted on the striking doctors to find a solution to the standoff. At 3.30pm, a group of doctors announced their stand. "We are hopeful that our CM will be considerate enough to solve the problems that the state is facing in the healthcare sector currently," they said in a statement while refusing to accept any question from the media. "We leave the decision to choose the venue to the honourable CM, but it should accommodate representatives of all medical colleges of West Bengal in sufficient numbers," the statement read. They expressed willingness to join work, "as early as possible in the best interest of the common people once our demands are addressed". In Video:AIIMS doctors call off strike, issue 48-hour ultimatum to Mamata govtDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Man posed as scribe to run extortion rin.description: NEW DELHI: A man has been arrested for allegedly running an extortion racket while posing as a senior TV news journalist. The accused, Sudhir, was nabbed while trying to collect Rs 2 lakh from a traffic police cop whom he had been blackmailing. Police said that the accused is a resident of Narela and was a part of a gang that blackmailed shop owners and policemen all over the city. The accused was nabbed near Narela while his associate escaped. The gang came up on the police radar after several complaints were received by traffic police personnel, where they said that a man claiming to be a journalist of a popular media house blackmailed them with videos of them allegedly indulging in malpractices. The man would threaten to air the videos on his channel if the personnel didn’t pay up. Similar complaints were also received from some shopkeepers, who were also blackmailed by a group of men claiming to be journalists. After a traffic police constable posted at Mangolpuri circle complained of being blackmailed for Rs 2 lakh, police laid a trap where the suspects were to collect the cash. Two men arrived at the pickup spot, were subsequently asked to provide their credentials. On checking, the cards were found to be fake. Sudhir was arrested, while the other man managed to slip away. In Video:Delhi: Man posed as scribe to run extortion ring, arrestedDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Congress spokesperson robbed of Rs 60,00.description: NEW DELHI: A Congress spokesperson became the latest victim of the notorious thak thak gang after four men on a motorcycle fled with her handbag containing approximately Rs 60,000 near Army Base hospital in Delhi Cantonment on Friday evening. Amrita Dhawan tweeted about the incident, claiming that the men diverted her attention and one of them snatched the bag through the window of her car. "I tried to pull back but he used a massive amount of force and fled," Dhawan said in her post. While lauding the co-operation and activeness of the staff of Delhi Cantonment Police Station, the Congress leader expressed shock at how brazenly the criminals operated in full public view. Police officers confirmed that the Thak Thak gang is suspected behind the robbery. A case has been registered. In Video:Delhi: Congress spokesperson robbed of Rs 60KDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Biker dies, rider hurt in South Delhi cr.description: NEW DELHI: A 26-year-old man riding a motorcycle died while the pillion rider was critically injured after the vehicle crashed into a divider on Nelson Mandela Marg in Vasant Kunj on Saturday evening. Police said that the victim has been identified as Raj Singh. His relative, Vir Shankar (28), is under medical observation. They were allegedly riding the bike at a high speed without wearing helmets. The cops said that Singh lost control of the bike at a curve on the road. Both the riders were flung in the air and suffered severe head injuries on falling. Singh died at the spot. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi: Fake IPS held for raping many wom.description: NEW DELHI: A man posing as an IPS officer with the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) was arrested from east Delhi’s Mayur Vihar. The accused had allegedly raped numerous women after promising to marry them. Police said that the accused has been identified as Piyush and a fake ID card was also recovered from him. Piyush came on the police radar after a woman filed a complaint against a man who claimed to an assistant commissioner of police, who had promised to marry her. The man allegedly sexually assaulted the woman and then absconded. A case was registered at Mayur Vihar Police Station based on her complaint. The woman provided the man’s mobile phone numbers and an account on a matrimonial website where the accused had contacted her. Using the information, the investigating teams nabbed the accused from his house. Along with the fake ID, the cops also recovered fake government stickers on his i10. Police said that the accused had created a profile on a matrimonial site where he introduced himself as an ACP. He would meet women and promise to marry them. He would sexually assault them and then block them from the profile. The accused had allegedly targeted several women with this modus operandi. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Police constable commits suicide in Delh.description: NEW DELHI: A 34-year-old Delhi Police constable allegedly committed suicide Sunday after hanging himself in Kanjhawala area here, officials said. The deceased constable was identified as Kulbir Singh, a resident of Kanjhawla, they said. He was a constable (driver) posted at the Delhi Police Control Room (PCR). According to a senior police officer, they received information regarding the incident from a hospital at around 11 am on Sunday. Singh was rushed to the hospital where he was declared brought dead, they said. During initial investigation, it was found that Singh hanged himself with a rope in a tin shed in a plot in Lal Dora here. The plot is away from his house, police said. Rajinder Singh, the father of the constable, said Kulbir Singh was depressed from the past 15 days. Kulbir Singh is survived by his wife and two children aged eight and 10, they added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Husband, in-laws held for killing woman.description: NEW DELHI: A month after a woman's body was recovered from a bag dumped beside a drain in outer Delhi's Jwala Puri, her husband, brother-in-law and mother-in-law have been arrested for killing her. Police said that the woman and her husband had a fight after he found out that she had been married earlier as well and had divorced her first husband. DCP (outer) Seju Kuruvilla said that Sarita had an argument with her husband Nikhil, and he strangled her to death. He then panicked and informed his brother and mother about it. The three then stuffed her body in a bag and dumped it beside the drain.  Nikhil told police that he had met Sarita in February and they both got married. Later she told him about her first marriage and that she had a child as well, which angered him. A case of murder has been registered against the three accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

A month after kidnapping and killing his.description: NEW DELHI: An aspiring chartered accountant was abducted for ransom and then murdered by a youth whom he had employed to drive his cab. The 28-year-old victim, Chandan Kumar Jha, was held hostage in a room in Noida and forced to call his family members to transfer Rs 2 lakh to his account, which the killer withdrew from different ATMs across Noida. Nearly, a month after this incident, the accused, Ankit, was arrested from east Delhi’s Jagatpuri. Jha’s family alleged that they had informed the cops at Shakarpur police station about the abduction on May 17, while the case was registered the next day. By the time the family learnt about his murder, Noida police had already cremated Jha’s body as it had remained unclaimed for over 72 hours. “We expected Delhi Police to act sincerely and help us recover the body. But when they got to know where the body was kept, it had already been cremated,” said Hari Om, Jha’s brother-in-law. On May 15, Ankit had called Jha to join him for a party in Noida. He then took him to an apartment that was rented by his friend Shyam. There, Ankit and Shyam forcefully locked up Jha in a room. The accused then called up Hari Om from Jha’s phone and asked him to transfer money into his account. Jha was then forced to reveal his ATM’s PIN to Ankit, who withdrew the money from different ATMs. Later that day, when Jha threatened to inform police once the accused let him go, the men decided to kill him. They took Jha to a secluded place near Greater Noida and strangled him. The body was dumped in a canal after which Ankit drove his car to a place near Ghaziabad and parked it at the road side. Jha’s body was recovered four days later and cremated after three days. Earlier this month, Delhi Police got in touch with their counterparts in Noida, learnt about Jha’s death and informed the family. They were asked to identify the deceased from the clothes he was wearing. The car, too, was recovered a few days later. According to DCP (East) Jasmeet Singh, when Ankit was questioned regarding the cab, he gave contradicting answers and claimed to have dropped Jha near a petrol pump. “While scrubbing through Ankit’s phone, we found his photos clicked on the day of the incident. His attire matched with the footage from the ATMs and when confronted, he confessed,” Singh said. A search is on to nab Shyam. During interrogation, Ankit said he presumed that Jha had a lot of money and decided to abduct him so that he could ask for a ransom of Rs 5 lakh. The family said that Jha had been pursuing CA coaching classes for the past five years. He had bought the car on finance and hired Ankit to drive it as a taxi so that he could earn enough money to pay for his tuitions. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Delhi: Cops bust gang of robbers active.description: NEW DELHI: A gang that moved in an autorickshaw and strangled victims to rob them has been busted. The men worked around Kalavati Hospital in Mandir Marg and were caught after a cop chased the men when a victim approached police. DCP (New Delhi) Madhur Verma said the victim, a relative of a patient at Kalavati Hospital, approached a police team and said that he was attacked by three men in an auto. Two men gagged him and started strangling him while the third took his belongings before fleeing. Constable Rajbir identified the auto and gave chase, and was able to nab one of the accused, Wakil. Based on Wakil’s statement, the other two accused — Parvesh and Mthilesh — were arrested as well. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal.
